snippet: Aleksei A. Navalny, Russia’s most resonant opposition voice and a Moscow mayoral candidate, was sentenced to five years in prison on embezzlement charges.
abstract: Aleksei A Navalny, Russia’s most prominent opposition leader, is sentenced to five years in prison on embezzlement charges, setting off demonstrations in Moscow; protesters condemn verdict as part of Pres Vladimir V Putin's campaign to corral opposition and block the rise of a popular challenger; Navalny could stay out of prison for a month, perhaps temporarily neutralizing anger at verdict while allowing him to run for mayor in September.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ellen Barry, Andrew E. Kramer, Andrew Roth, Alexandra Kozlova, Anna Tikhomirova and Noah Sneider from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Aleksei A. Navalny, Russia’s most resonant opposition voice and a Moscow mayoral candidate, was sentenced to five years in prison on embezzlement charges.

headline.main: Putin Critic Gets 5-Year Jail Term, Setting Off Protests
headline.print_headline: Protests Erupt Over Sentence Of Putin Critic
